translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Ekavihāri

analyzed: ñā ṇ attha vika ttheḥ a padāna
translated: The Elder Ñāṇatthavika’s Birth Story
“Like a flowering kanikāra,🔽like a shining dīpa tree,
shining like gold,
I saw the supreme human.
Putting down my water pot,
my bark-cloth and my water strainer,
arranging my deerskin cloak over one shoulder,
I worshipped the best of Buddhas.
‘You have destroyed the darkness,
the tangled net of delusion;
having shown the light of knowledge,
you have crossed over, great sage.
The world with its ocean and its edge,🔽all of it unsurpassed,
there is no simile for your knowledge,
as far as the world goes.
Through that knowledge you are all-knowing,
thus you are called a Buddha;
I worship you, great hero,
all-knowing, unsurpassed.’
For a hundred thousand eons,
I worshipped the best of Buddhas;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of Ñāṇatthavika.
My defilements are destroyed,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me,🔽…
the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.
The four discriminations,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ñāṇatthaviko thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā ñāṇatthavikaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Teacher’s bidding.”🔽Thus have I heard: this was said by the Elder Thera Nāṇatthavī.
The Story of the Elder Nāṇatthavī is finished.
